reason.raw: Triaging pull requests. ARIAC is complete, and our focus is currently on gazebo 11.
reason.html: Triaging pull requests. ARIAC is complete, and our focus is currently on gazebo 11.

description.raw:
Sensors can be "turned on and off" using the `SetActive` method. 

* Sensors are inactive by default and thus require `SetActive` to be called on them to be turned on. 

* If the `<always_on>` flag is set to true on SDF, `SetActive` is [called](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/731b32893db68d522347244d058ddfe284754330/gazebo/sensors/Sensor.cc?at=gazebo7&fileviewer=file-view-default#Sensor.cc-96) the moment the sensor is loaded.

Contact sensors work by:

* Creating a filter with the `ContactManager`, so the manager publishes filtered contacts on a dedicated topic

* Subscribing to that topic

* Republishing the slightly modified filtered contacts on a sensor custom topic

Right now, even when the sensor is not active, there is a filter on `ContactManager`, the sensor is subscribing to that topic and not doing anything on the callback. For performance improvements, this pull request creates and removes the filter on demand as the sensor is turned on and off.
description.html:
Sensors can be "turned on and off" using the SetActive method.

  • Sensors are inactive by default and thus require SetActive to be called on them to be turned on.

  • If the <always_on> flag is set to true on SDF, SetActive is called the moment the sensor is loaded.

Contact sensors work by:

  • Creating a filter with the ContactManager, so the manager publishes filtered contacts on a dedicated topic

  • Subscribing to that topic

  • Republishing the slightly modified filtered contacts on a sensor custom topic

Right now, even when the sensor is not active, there is a filter on ContactManager, the sensor is subscribing to that topic and not doing anything on the callback. For performance improvements, this pull request creates and removes the filter on demand as the sensor is turned on and off.

title: Contact sensor performance improvement

summary.raw:
Sensors can be "turned on and off" using the `SetActive` method. 

* Sensors are inactive by default and thus require `SetActive` to be called on them to be turned on.

Contact sensors work by:

* Creating a filter with the `ContactManager`, so the manager publishes filtered contacts on a dedicated topic

* Subscribing to that topic

* Republishing the slightly modified filtered contacts on a sensor custom topic

Right now, even when the sensor is not active, there is a filter on `ContactManager`, the sensor is subscribing to that topic and not doing anything on the callback. For performance improvements, this pull request creates and removes the filter on demand as the sensor is turned on and off.
summary.html:
Sensors can be "turned on and off" using the SetActive method.

  • Sensors are inactive by default and thus require SetActive to be called on them to be turned on.

  • If the <always_on> flag is set to true on SDF, SetActive is called the moment the sensor is loaded.

Contact sensors work by:

  • Creating a filter with the ContactManager, so the manager publishes filtered contacts on a dedicated topic

  • Subscribing to that topic

Right now, even when the sensor is not active, there is a filter on ContactManager, the sensor is subscribing to that topic and not doing anything on the callback. For performance improvements, this pull request creates and removes the filter on demand as the sensor is turned on and off.
